perturbation.original_text:
Except for article 3.1 hereabove, payments shall be made by wire transfer to the bank nominated by Licensor, in maximum 45 days after the issuance by NLS of the corresponding invoices,
In the event any payment due under this Agreement is not made at the agreed term and/or for the corresponding full amount, a
late payment charge of ten percent (10 %) p.a. is due, calculated on a pro-rata basis of the number of days between the date at
which the outstanding amount was due for payment to Licensor and the date is actually paid.
perturbation.changed_text:
Except for article 3.1 hereabove, payments shall be made by wire transfer to the bank nominated by Licensor, in maximum 60 days after the issuance by NLS of the corresponding invoices,
In the event any payment due under this Agreement is not made at the agreed term and/or for the corresponding full amount, a
late payment charge of ten percent (10 %) p.a. is due, calculated on a pro-rata basis of the number of days between the date at
which the outstanding amount was due for payment to Licensor and the date is actually paid.
perturbation.explanation: Changing the payment deadline from 45 days to 60 days creates a direct contradiction. This ambiguity causes uncertainty about when a payment is considered late and when late payment charges apply, thus affecting the enforcement of payment terms.

perturbation.original_text: Royalty payments shall be paid quarterly within thirty (45) days following the close of the calendar quarter.
perturbation.changed_text: Royalty payments shall be paid quarterly within sixty (60) days following the close of the calendar quarter.
perturbation.explanation: Changing the payment deadline for royalty payments from 45 days to 60 days creates a direct contradiction to section 3.6 (Payment Terms) that states 'payments shall be made by wire transfer to the bank nominated by Licensor, in maximum 45 days after the issuance by NLS of the corresponding invoices'.

perturbation.original_text:
Promptly upon the request of Licensor, the Licensee shall, at the Licensor’s sole discretion and election for each country
of the Territory and each Licensed Product either withdraw or transfer all Marketing Authorizations in the Territory to
the Licensor (or to a third party as the Licensor directs). Licensee shall take the required steps without any delay and the
withdrawal or transfer shall be completed in maximum 90 days after the notification of the request; if the Licensor does
not decide and inform within this period to whom the Marketing Authorizations and documents shall be transferred,
then the Licensee shall have no obligation to keep them active.
perturbation.changed_text:
Promptly upon the request of Licensor, the Licensee shall, at the Licensor’s sole discretion and election for each country
of the Territory and each Licensed Product either withdraw or transfer all Marketing Authorizations in the Territory to
the Licensor (or to a third party as the Licensor directs). Licensee shall take the required steps without any delay and the
withdrawal or transfer shall be completed in maximum 30 days after the notification of the request; if the Licensor does
not decide and inform within this period to whom the Marketing Authorizations and documents shall be transferred,
then the Licensee shall have no obligation to keep them active.
perturbation.explanation: Changing the time to transfer MA to 30 days causes a contradiction to section 3.6 which states the Licensor will issue corresponding invoices and payments will be made after 45 days. Here the licensee is expected to transfer everything within 30 days.
